title: Doc charged with tax evasion
text:
Thursday, 23 February 2017 Doc charged with tax evasion 
SHAH ALAM: A specialist doctor at a private medical centre was charged in a magistrate's court here with seven counts of tax evasion totalling more than RM700,000. 
Dr Ahmad Nizar Jamaluddin, 56, was not in court yesterday and was represented by one Rudy Kurniawan Usman, who pleaded not guilty to all the charges before magistrate Khairul Nizam Abu Bakar. 
According to a court interpreter, Dr Ahmad Nizar had submitted a letter of authority to the court to inform that he was unable to attend the proceedings and would be represented by Rudy Kurniawan. 
The doctor was charged with wilfully and with intent to evade paying tax for the amount which should have been included in Form BE for the assessment years of 2007, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012 and 2013, resulting in a lower tax of RM729,968.25. 
The amount of tax he was supposed to pay for 2007 was RM66,414.60; RM123,326.82 in 2008, RM120,017.43 in 2009, RM104,760.76 in 2010, RM97,583.72 in 2011, RM89,545.30 in 2012 and RM128,319.62 in 2013. 
The tax was for income totalling RM2.763mil. 
The charges were made under Section 114 (1)(a) of the Income Tax Act which provides a fine of up to RM20,000, or imprisonment of up to three years, or both, and a special penalty of three times the amount of tax which had been undercharged on each count, upon conviction. 
The court set March 15 for mention. â€” Bernama
